title: Bangkok tourism students launch iluvBKK travel campaign
text:
Bangkok tourism students launch iluvBKK travel campaign   
By Andrew J. Wood, eTN Thailand Correspondent | Sep 16, 2015 eTN   
BANGKOK, Thailand - Student Panyakorn Nettip, from Bangkok's Assumption University’s Department of Hospitality and Tourism Management, launched a new tourism campaign aimed at the international and domestic student market, beginning with an iluvBKK social media campaign. 
Mr. Panyakorn’s marketing strategy includes a website (iluvbkk.com) and an iluvBKK social media campaign on 3 platforms; Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. The iluvBKK targets the next generation of travelers, students, and offers a chance to win a holiday in Bangkok. 
Students are encouraged to upload their photos, with a homemade iluvBKK message and share online for a chance to win a holiday in Bangkok on September 25, 2015. 
The holiday includes "Selfie Tours" sponsored by Southeast Asia travel specialist, Khiri Travel and organized by their sister organization, Phuchan Travel. The contest winner and guest will receive a full day of great photo opportunities to shoot loads of selfies with unusual backdrops, to share with Facebook, Twitter and Instagram friends. 
The room nights are generously sponsored by the Rembrandt Hotel Bangkok and include superior accommodations and breakfast for two. 
Mr. Panyakorn and friends from Assumption University’s Department of Hospitality and Tourism Management have volunteered to serve as Thailand’s unofficial Ambassadors of Hospitality for contest winners. 
With guidance Ajarn Scott Michael Smith, Mr. Panyakorn will manage the iluvbkk website and social media platforms and launch a separate tourism campaign in three weeks aimed at the Meeting, Incentive, Convention and Exhibition (MICE) at the Taipei International Convention Center September 24-25, 2015.
